doc.after: Medieval Latin is the written Latin in use during that portion of the post classical period when no corresponding Latin vernacular existed The spoken language had developed into the various incipient Romance languages however in the educated and official world Latin continued without its natural spoken base Moreover this Latin spread into lands that had never spoken Latin such as the Germanic and Slavic nations It became useful for international communication between the member states of the Holy Roman Empire and its allies
